title: Bison Travel to Northwestern Saturday
text: Bison Travel to Northwestern Saturday Comment Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 9:52 AM Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 9:52 AM Oklahoma Baptist looks for its first road win in a tough place Saturday, heading to Alva to take on Northwestern Oklahoma State. Oklahoma Baptist is 0-3 on the season on the road, losing by an average score of 43-19 in losses at Arkansas Tech, Southeastern Oklahoma State and Southern Arkansas. The Bison are 4-2-2 all-time against Northwestern Oklahoma State. The last game was a 34-0 Bison victory in 1940. That win capped a string of five consecutive OBU shutouts against the Rangers (including one scoreless tie). Northwestern Oklahoma State last beat the Bison at the end of the 1921 season. Coached by Matt Walter, the Rangers ended a four-game slide last week by beating Southeastern Oklahoma State and improved to 2-4 on the season. Northwestern averages 288 yards through the air and 61 yards on the ground through six games. Reid Miller is the quarterback and has completed 60 percent of his passes and averages 262 yards per game. The top receiver is Justin Schanbacher with 26 catches and 307 yards but three different Rangers have 20 or more receptions. On the ground, Zachary Doyle leads the way with 23 yards per game. The Bison counter with a banged-up secondary led by D’Ante Meeking with three interceptions. Zack Bishop leads the team with 53 tackles, while Jailen Garrett is right there with 51. Averaging 67.4 yards per game, Jordan Barnes is the team’s leading rusher. Dual threat Dez Stegall has a306 yards rushing and 421 through the air. The top receiver is Derek Serowski wth 216 yards, while Stephan Turner has 22 receptions. Jordan Norris has a GAC-leading six interceptions to lead the Northwestern resistance, while Devon Payton leads the squad with 65 tackles. Joby Saint Fleur leads the GAC with 6.5 sacks this season. The Massey Ratings have Northwestern Oklahoma State winning the game 34-24. The game can be heard at www.obubisonlive.com . The game also is live in Shawnee at AM-1450 KGFF with play by play by John Parrish and color commentary by Norris Russell. In game updates are also available on Twitter @Bison_Gameday. NWOSU will broadcast the game with links available at riderangersride.com . The Shawnee News-Star
